doc.name: ColtChiSquare
doc.description:
Produce a random sequence with a ChiSquare distribution. On each iteration, a new random number is produced. The output port is of type DoubleToken. The values that are generated are independent and identically distributed with the freedom and the standard deviation given by parameters. In addition, the seed can be specified as a parameter to control the sequence that is generated.

This actor instantiates a cern.jet.random.ChiSquare object with freedom argument set to 1.0. The Chi Square Distribution is

A special case of the Gamma distribution.

p(x) = (1/g(f/2)) * (x/2)^(f/2-1) * exp(-x/2) with g(a) being the gamma function and f being the degrees of freedom.

Valid parameter ranges: freedom > 0.

The above description of Chi Square is copyrighted.

A definition of the ChiSquare distribution can be found at http://www.cern.ch/RD11/rkb/AN16pp/node31.html#SECTION000310000000000000000
doc.author: David Bauer and Kostas Oikonomou
doc.property: freedom. This has type double with default value 1.0.
